page.title: 06PULHAM SCHOOL TRIP
page.content: Carrie spent 5 days in September with 20 local children & 3 adults at How Hill Centre for Environmental Studies on the Norfolk Broads.The weather was warm & dry,all day was spent in the open.The warden & his helpers organised visits to Barton Broad,the marshes,woods & water gardens to find out about birds,plants & animals,& studies of Irstead church,Ludham village & Turf Fen windmill were made. Mini-beasts were fished out of a dyke & examined under magnifying lenses.The children kept diaries & enjoyed their trip.They slept in dormitories in How Hill House,which is thatched & has beautiful gardens & lawns. {Parent Participation}Hardwick area. Some adults are governors,PTA members & give practical support & raise money for local schools.
